section.name: Data repositories
section.p: To avoid duplication of genome, annotation and genome index files, Eoulsan handles data repositories. It is very useful for genome indexes used in mapping step witch computation is quite long for large genomes. Using a genome index repository store the result the index computations for a genome for the next analysis.

File extension (e.g. .fasta, .gff) and file compression extensions must be avoided in the genome and annotation URL. Eoulsan automatically add the file extension and check if a compressed file exists in the repository.

subsection.name: Genome index repository
subsection.p: Unlike previous repositories, the genome index repository have no dedicated protocol. The only user of this repository is the genome index creation step. When a genome index must be computed, this step check if a genome index has been already computed for this genome and mapper. If true, the previous computed genome is used, if false, the genome index is computed and then stored for a next usage.
To use genome index repository, user must only define the following global parameter (In configuration file or in the globals section of the parameter file) :

tr.td: Path to the genome indexes repository

subsection.p: Note: The path to the genome indexes cannot be an URL. The path must be writtable for the user to allow Eoulsan storing genome indexes.
